#Text=Chaweng
#Text=Chaweng
#Text=is a beach on the east coast of Ko Samui .
#Text=It has a lovely white beach and vibrant nightlife , especially at its north end .
#Text=Understand

#Text=Chaweng is the largest and most popular of Samui 's beaches , and is usually divided into three sections : North Chaweng , Central Chaweng and Chaweng Noi ( Little Chaweng ) around a headland to the south .
#Text=Chaweng Beach is the longest beach on Samui 's east coast .
#Text=The beach is beautiful here and local developers are finally cleaning up some of the trashy areas nearby .
#Text=It attracts many young travellers and families alike , but still remains good value for money .
#Text=The beach is approximately 7 km long with powdery white sand .
#Text=It is bordered by emerald-blue waters and a coral reef where waves break , leaving the bay quite peaceful .
#Text=Not far from the beach , there are two small islands near the reef .
#Text=After swimming , you can explore the nearest one by walking through shallow water or go for snorkelling and kayaking at the second island which is further out and larger .
#Text=The central part of the beach is a bit more crowded than the quieter north .
#Text=Many vendors pass by , offering beverages , fruit , ice cream and local Thai food for the more daring .
#Text=A variety of local crafts and Thai souvenirs are also available .
#Text=The beach itself is usually accessed through the hotels , as there are no beach roads to disturb the peacefulness of the area .
#Text=It is very relaxing but noticeably more touristy during the high season .
#Text=The water is clean with normal temperatures between 25-28°C .
#Text=Parallel to the beach , clustered in the middle of the strip , lies Samui 's greatest concentration of restaurants , bars , souvenir shops , and of course , fast food and convenience stores .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Chaweng is a few minutes ride south of the airport .
#Text=If you book a taxi at the airport 's transport desk , it will cost 400 baht .
#Text=A shared van ( usually requiring 5 passengers before it departs ) will cost 120 baht per person .
#Text=Taxi drivers rarely use taxi meters here .
#Text=If you decide not to use the booking desk , negotiate the fare in advance with the taxi driver .
#Text=It should cost from 200-400 baht .
#Text=Or you may book a transfer with your hotel .
#Text=This service usually costs 300 baht , though some of the higher-end hotels have quoted rates of 400 baht per person .
#Text=You may opt to take other , more adventurous forms of transportation like the following :
#Text=Motorcycle taxis are ordinary motorbikes and you sit behind the driver during the ride .
#Text=Depending on the distance , the price ranges from 30-150 baht .
#Text=Motorbike rentals are available if riding solo is what you prefer .
#Text=Most motorbike rentals in Chaweng offer 100-125 cc bikes such as Honda Waves , Honda Clicks , Suzuki Steps , etc.
#Text=Rentals cost 100-200 baht per day depending on the length of the rental .
#Text=Bigger motorbikes like Harley Davidson 's and sport bikes like Kawasaki Ninjas and Honda CBRs are also available .
#Text=Be warned that bike accidents tend to be a regular occurrence in Ko Samui , so drive carefully .
#Text=If you are travelling in a large group , you may opt to rent a Jeep .
#Text=The rental usually costs at least 800 baht per day .
#Text=A private car will set you back 1,500 baht or more per day .
#Text=There are many models to choose from :
#Text=Honda Jazz , Isuzu Hi-Lander , Toyota Camry , Toyota Fortuner , etc.
#Text=Established rental companies such as Avis and Hertz also offer insurance .
#Text=It might be a good idea to get the insurance along with the rental as having no insurance and an accident could be expensive .
#Text=Do
#Text=Almost all activities are on the beach ( even parts of the nightlife ) and most Samui dive shops are based in Chaweng .
#Text=It 's also the base to arrange trips to nearby Ko Tao and the Ang Thong National Marine Park .
#Text=Calypso Diving Koh Samui
#Text=Offers all kind of PADI Dive courses from beginner to professional .
#Text=Calypso also organize individual dive , snorkelling , and island trips to Ko Pha Ngan , Ko Tao and Ang Thong National Marine Park .
#Text=Two modern high-speed catamarans make the journey very comfortable and safe .
#Text=At Ko Tao is a tour boat with all the facilities required for a fun-filled day .
#Text=Maximum 24 passengers per boat .
#Text=Small groups : maximum 5 divers , 10 snorkellers per professional dive guide .
#Text=Magnolia Spa
#Text=The only spa in Thailand that stocks and uses the complete range of products from Dead Sea Minerals .
#Text=Next to it is the Magnolia Cafe , with great breads and cakes , as well as other food .
#Text=100 Degrees East
#Text=, ☏ +6677245936 , ✉ info@100degreeseast.com .
#Text=5 Star
#Text=PADI Dive Resort and a BSAC Resort Centre .
#Text=Safe diving in a friendly and supportive environment in which you can relax , have fun and enjoy your time .
#Text=The Salamander Dive Centre
#Text=Diving courses and tours , arranging all your travel needs .
#Text=Stocks all diving equipment needed in your course or tour , for purchase and rental too .
#Text=Buy
#Text=There are lots of souvenir shops around town .
#Text=It is not uncommon for the shopkeepers to ask 5 times the normal tourist price particularly in the central areas .
#Text=Bargaining is always acceptable when it comes to souvenirs .
#Text=Even when a price is indicated a discount up to 50 % might be available .

#Text=As many shops and the often cheaper market stalls sell mostly similar products , ask at several places to get an idea of what is a reasonable price before starting haggling for the product you really want .
#Text=The clothing sold here can often be found at Khao San Road in Bangkok for a lower price .
#Text=On the beach , vendors will sell beach clothes , jewelry , beach toys and games , and food ( coconuts , sliced fruit , satay , roasted corn , ice cream , water , etc. ) .
#Text=Be prepared to bargain .
#Text=Most food items are generally 50 baht/piece .
#Text=The vendors will not bother you if you ignore them or say no .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Chef 's Table
#Text=, ☏ +6677914333 , ✉ rsvn@sareeraya.com .
#Text=Local dishes , fresh seafood , international cuisine .
#Text=Fine wines and delicious drinks to match the luxurious tropical atmosphere and outstanding setting .
#Text=Cloud Restaurant & Bar
#Text=( Next to Khun Chaweng Resort and Stars Cabaret ) .
#Text=Trendy restaurant and bar in the centre of Chaweng .

#Text=Ice cold beer , an amazing range of cocktails and a delicious selection of well-presented meals , including Thai food from 100 baht and a variety of Western favourites like pizzas , pastas , and burgers from under 200 baht .
#Text=Khao San Road Restaurant
#Text=( Near to Soi Green Mango ) .
#Text=The breakfast/lunch meeting point for backpackers and a good base camp to select a hostel and meet fellow travellers .
#Text=Ninja
#Text=( Across the street from Baan Samui Resort and Chaweng Buri Resort ) .
#Text=A nice family-owned traditional Thai place with very reasonable prices .
#Text=Do n't expect a fancy interior , but very tasty food at cheap prices .
#Text=Poppies Samui
#Text=( At the lower end of Chaweng Beach ) .
#Text=Has an excellent international and Thai restaurant if you are after exquisite surroundings presided over by a great chef .
#Text=Sea Food Centre
#Text=( About half a kilometre inland from Coco Blues Bar ) .
#Text=A set of about 5 seafood restaurants .
#Text=One 's called StoneFish , a great place with excellent service .
#Text=The food is amazing and they will grill/cook/boil/steam it just the way you would like to have it .
